headline: Deng suffered a double dislocation of his right middle finger in Monday's overtime win over the Pacers, Ethan Skolnick of the Miami Herald reports.
X-rays on Udrih's foot came back negative following his early departure from Monday's game against the Pacers, Ethan Skolnick of the Miami Herald reports.
Whiteside scored 19 points (8-17 FG, 3-4 FT) while pulling down 18 rebounds with six blocks during 41 minutes off the bench in Monday's 101-93 overtime win against the Pacers.
Dragic scored a team-high 24 points (10-17 FG, 1-2 3Pt, 3-6 FT) to go along with eight rebounds and five assists over 41 minutes in Monday's 101-93 overtime win against the Pacers.
Deng scored 13 points (5-18 FG, 0-3 3Pt, 3-5 FT) but ripped down 16 rebounds over 37 minutes in Monday's 101-93 overtime win against the Pacers.
Udrih wil not return to Monday's matchup with the Pacers due to a left foot injury, Jason Lieser of The Palm Beach Post reports.
Green will draw the start Monday versus the the Pacers, Ethan J. Skolnick of the Miami Herald reports.
Winslow will come off the bench Monday versus the Pacers, Ethan J. Skolnick of the Miami Herald reports.

Wade (knee) is listed as questionable for Monday's game against the Pacers, Ira Winderman of the South Florida Sun Sentinel reports.
Green only contributed five points (2-8 FG, 1-3 3Pt), two rebounds and a block in 29 minutes on Saturday in a win against the Wizards.
Deng scored 27 points (11-18 FG, 0-1 3Pt, 5-5 FT) to go along with 10 rebounds, four assists and a steal in 35 minutes on Saturday in a win over the Wizards.

Dragic scored 24 points (9-20 FG, 0-3 3Pt, 6-7 FT) to go along with eight assists, seven rebounds and a block in 30 minutes on Saturday in a win against the Wizards.
Stoudemire will get the start Saturday against the Wizards, the Palm Beach Post's Jason Lieser reports.
Wade (knee) will not play Saturday against the Wizards, the Miami Herald's Ethan Skolnick reports.
Green will start at shooting guard again Saturday against the Wizards, the Miami Herald's Ethan Skolnick reports.

Wade (knee) is listed as questionable for Saturday's game against the Wizards, Tim Reynolds of the Associated Press reports.
Winslow garnered the start at small forward in Friday's win over the Hawks and finished with 13 points (5-13 FG, 0-3 3Pt, 3-4 FT), nine rebounds, and two steals across 37 minutes.
Dragic dropped 17 points (6-14 FG, 1-4 3Pt, 4-5 FT), 10 assists, five rebounds, and four steals across 33 minutes during the Heat's 115-111 win against the Hawks on Friday.
Deng delivered 30 points (11-17 FG, 1-3 3Pt, 7-10 FT), 11 rebounds, and four steals in 38 minutes during the Heat's 115-111 win over the Hawks on Friday.
McRoberts poured in 19 points (8-13 FG, 3-5 3Pt), 10 assists, and six rebounds in 30 minutes during the Heat's 115-111 victory over the Hawks on Friday.
Green registered 14 points (6-13 FG, 1-3 3Pt, 1-3 FT), five rebounds, two assists, two steals, and one block in 37 minutes during the Heat's 115-111 win against the Hawks on Friday.

Wade is set to have an MRI on his injured knee over the weekend. "It's just soreness in the back of my left knee that I haven't felt in awhile. We'll get back tomorrow, get a MRI and check it out," said Wade on Friday
Green will start Friday's game in Atlanta, Shandel Richardson of the South Florida Sun Sentinel reports.

Green is averaging 7.6 points (on 38.2% shooting), 4.4 rebounds, 0.8 assists, and 0.6 treys across 25.4 minutes over five appearances in February.
Roberts was involved in a three-team trade Tuesday which ultimately sends him to Miami, Adrian Wojnarowski of The Vertical reports.
Bosh (claf) will resume taking blood thinners to treat a blood clot in his leg, Tim Reynolds of NBA.com reports.

Bosh is dealing with another blood-clotting incident in his left calf and will undergo further medical examinations Thursday to determine whether or not he'll be able to return this season, Adrian Wojnarowski of The Vertical reports.
Bosh is undergoing further testing on his calf as there's growing concern he's dealing with something more severe than a strain, Barry Jackson of the Miami Herald reports.
Stokes was recalled from the D-League on Monday.
